plot: When the leader of an alien culture takes a romantic interest in Lt. Yar, he claims her for his own, to the dismay of his own wife, who, in turn, challenges Tasha in a fight to the death.

The Enterprise travels to the planet Ligon II to collect a vaccine that will prevent a particularly virulent disease on Federation planet Cyrus IV. The planet's leader, Lutan, is more than pleased to provide them with the cure but while on board takes a particular interest in the ship's security officer, Lt. Tasha Yar. He is attracted to her physically and is intrigued at her obvious skills and intelligence. He kidnaps her to show that he is a brave man but when the time comes for her return, he refuses to do so wanting to make her his first wife. His current first wife challenges Tasha to a fight to the death to retain her position. Meanwhile, Data continues to try and understand humor but the nuances continue to escape him.—garykmcd

To save millions during an epidemic, the Enterprise must urgently collect a rare medicine from the sole producer, planet Ligon II, so its chief executive Lutan gets the VIP treatment. His rather arrogant attitude is handled smiling, but after his bodyguard Hagon is humiliatingly defeated repeatedly by ship security lieutenant Yar, Lutan surprisingly has her kidnapped to his planet. Picard must personally go conduct negotiations to secure the cure and her release, which is promised. But at the transfer banquet, Yar is challenged to a duel to death by Lutan's wife, whose hereditary wealth is crucial for his social position.—KGF Vissers
